summary: This is an email chain from November 24, 2020, in which a paralegal from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC forwards a request to an FBI agent. The request seeks reimbursement for therapy treatment for a Florida-based victim of Jeffrey Epstein who lacks health insurance. The email includes attached invoices from a counseling center.

persons.name: Maria Kelljchian
persons.context: She is a Florida Registered Paralegal at Edwards Pottinger LLC who sends an email to an FBI agent seeking reimbursement for a victim's therapy treatment.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: She is copied on the email from Maria Kelljchian regarding the victim's treatment reimbursement request.

persons.name: Maria Cardenal
persons.context: She is copied on the email from Maria Kelljchian regarding the victim's treatment reimbursement request.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: He is copied on the email from his firm's paralegal, Maria Kelljchian, regarding a victim's treatment reimbursement request.

persons.name: Shelley Kavanagh
persons.context: She is the Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) at Oakbrook Counseling Center who provided therapy to the victim; her invoices are attached to the email.

connections.description: Maria Kelljchian is a paralegal at the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC, where Brad Edwards is presumably a partner/attorney.
Kelljchian is seeking reimbursement for therapy services provided by Kavanagh to an Epstein victim.
Edwards' law firm is involved in seeking payment for therapy services Kavanagh provided to a client/victim.

events.title: Request for Victim Treatment Reimbursement
events.description: Paralegal Maria Kelljchian emails an FBI agent to request reimbursement for therapy treatment paid for by a Florida-based Epstein victim.

locations.address: Oakbrook Counseling Center, 4804 W. Commercial Blvd., Tamarac, FL 33319
locations.context: The counseling center where victim received therapy from Shelley Kavanagh.

locations.address: 425 North Andrews Avenue, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, Florida 33301
locations.context: The address of the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC.

keyFacts: A Florida-based victim of Jeffrey Epstein sought therapy but lacked health insurance and paid for treatment out-of-pocket.
The law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC, through paralegal Maria Kelljchian, contacted the FBI to seek reimbursement for these therapy costs on behalf of the victim.
Invoices from therapist Shelley Kavanagh of Oakbrook Counseling Center were attached to the request, one paid ($900) and one outstanding.
The FBI had previously interviewed the victim in question, indicating ongoing law enforcement involvement in victim support.
The communication highlights the financial and healthcare burdens faced by Epstein victims and the role of legal representatives in seeking restitution.
